translation: But the great souls, O Arjuna, partaking of My divine nature, worship Me with a single-minded devotion, knowing Me as the imperishable source of all beings.
commentary: 9.13 great souls great souls? You but? Mam Me? Partha O Partha? Divine divine? Prakritim nature? dependents refuged (in)? worship worship? Ananyamanasah with a mind devoted to nothing else? knowing having known? Bhutadim the source of beings? Avyayam imperishable.Commentary Jnatva Bhutadimavyayam There is another interpretation -- knowing Me to be the source or the origin of beings and imperishable.Daivim
